page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: The farms of the area are mainly pastoral.{Dairy farming}is the main commercial activity. This may prove to be less important in the future as a result of recent E.E.C. moves to cut down on milk production. Several farms use some of their grazing for horses, {horse riding}being a popular leisure pursuit particularly with young girls. Fenns Farm has been given over entirely to stables. Moorbank Farm is fairly typical of farms in the area. It was built in 1632 and now has a Dutch barn and a cattle shed in addition to the farmhouse. The land-use is mainly improved grass, some of which is used to provide hay for winter fodder. The fields vary in size from 3 to 10 acres The farmer employs only one part-time worker. The livestock consists of 50 Fresian cows, 3 goats and 5 horses.
